alert.note: Alert for Moses Lake Area; Upper Columbia Basin (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Air Stagnation Advisory issued December 16 at 1:31AM PST until December 18 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...AIR STAGNATION ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST MONDAY... ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...For the Air Stagnation Advisory, stagnant conditions will have potential to trap pollutants near the ground with deteriorated air quality. For the Dense Fog Advisory, visibility between a quarter and one mile in dense fog. * WHERE...Harrington, Othello, Creston, Coulee City, Odessa, Quincy, Wilbur, Moses Lake, Ephrata, Grand Coulee, and Ritzville. * WHEN...For the Air Stagnation Advisory, until 10 AM PST Monday. For the Dense Fog Advisory, until 10 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Periods of air stagnation can lead to the buildup of pollutants near the surface. Low visibility could make driving conditions hazardous.
info.instruction: Buildup of fine pollution particles can be harmful to those sensitive to air pollution including people with lung and heart problems, people with diabetes, children and the elderly. If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you.

area.areaDesc: Moses Lake Area; Upper Columbia Basin
